poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32) - January 9, 2023

discourse_list.title: MIP4c2-SP32: Remove MIP14c4: Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling

content.content: MIP4c2-SP32: Remove MIP14c4: Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling  Preamble MIP4c2-SP#: 32 MIP to be amended: 14 Author(s): @Patrick_J Contributors: Tags: mip-amendment Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2022-12-08 Date Ratified: 2023-01-23 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip4c2-sp32-remove-mip14c4-protocol-dai-transfer-ceiling/19093 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmPHFiYP   Specification  Motivation With the coming transition to the Endgame state, GovAlpha is anticipating an increase in funding requests through MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer and MIP55: Special Purpose Fund. MIP14c4 places a cap on the total amount of DAI that can be distributed through MIP14. The number chosen, 250,000 DAI, is arbitrary and amendment requires a full Monthly Governance Cycle. Consequently, a failure state exists where the sum of all fund requests in a Governance Cycle through MIP14 will exceed the ceiling and/or it will not be possible to raise with sufficient lead-time to distribute Maker Governance approved funds in a timely manner. Rather than dealing with sequential subproposals to raise the Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling, or setting it to an arbitrarily high number that renders it useless, it makes more sense to simply remove this restriction. The remaining content of MIP14 remains appropriate, in my opinion. There is no need to replace the whole MIP.  Amended MIPs and Components   MIP14c4 is removed by this subproposal.   Amendment Pull Request  Pull Request   Relevant Information We have already received two MIP14c2 proposals that sum to 182,454 DAI:  MIP14c2-SP1 MIP14c2-SP2
content.GPT-summary: The author is proposing to remove MIP14c4, which places a cap on the total amount of DAI that can be distributed through MIP14. The author argues that this cap is arbitrary and can cause issues in the future. The proposal has been accepted and the author provides relevant information about previous proposals. No 3rd party is advertising, collaborating, or giving entirely positive or negative feedback on the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: This is a summary of the contents of this subproposal and its impact, from GovAlpha’s perspective:  This is a valid MIP4c2: Amendment Process for MIPs Older than 3 Months subproposal. This subproposal amends MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer. It specifically removes the component c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling). Alongside MIP40: Budget Framework and MIP55: Special Purpuse Fund, MIP14 is one of the ratified mechanisms to transfer Dai out of the protocol. Out of the three, MIP14 is the most generic one and has no restrictions as to how it may be used. MIP14c4 sets a limit on how much Dai can be transferred out of the protocol cumulatively (i.e., the tally is kept across every use of MIP14). The author anticipates the MIP14 generic mechanism being put to use frequently enough during the transition towards the Endgame that the limit will become a hindrance to swift governance. If this subproposal is ratified, c4 will be removed from MIP14. This proposal has been assigned Medium-Impact based on the methodology listed here.  Disclaimer: These summaries are intended to be a guide and not a source of truth. You remain responsible for any actions you take on the grounds of this information. Please note the date when the summary was last updated to judge accuracy. Updated 2022-12-26
@MIP-Editors please submit this to the January Governance Cycle

This subproposal will fulfill the minimum RFC period requested to be eligible for January’s Governance Cycle a few hours after the Formal Submission window closes. However, since the requirements in MIP0 and MIP51 have been followed and given the fact that it aims to address a growing and urgent need in the Maker community, GovAlpha has allowed for it to be formally submitted to the current  cycle. Please reach out to @MIP-Editors if you have any questions.
This proposal is currently being voted on. Its Ratification Poll will run until 2023-01-23. Please vote here.
